name: APT Threat Intelligence Ingestion
intent: Ingest 31 APT (Advanced Persistent Threat) and Malware IoC files containing real-world threat intelligence from state-sponsored actors, ransomware groups, and cybercriminal organizations into Neo4j knowledge graph.
business_value: HIGH - Enables threat actor attribution, real-world IoC database, campaign tracking, sector targeting analysis, and vulnerability exploitation mapping
technical_complexity: MEDIUM - XML parsing, entity extraction, Neo4j bulk insertion, relationship creation
implementation_readiness: READY - Complete documentation with TASKMASTER v1.0, data sources verified, 4-5 day timeline estimated

name: STIX 2.1 Threat Intelligence Integration
intent: Enable AEON Digital Twin to ingest, process, and integrate STIX 2.1 (Structured Threat Information Expression) formatted threat intelligence into Neo4j knowledge graph for standardized threat intelligence sharing and interoperability.
business_value: HIGH - Standards compliance, interoperability with security orchestration platforms (SOAR), automated threat intelligence sharing (TAXII), industry-standard format adoption
technical_complexity: MEDIUM - STIX 2.1 schema validation, Neo4j mapping, MITRE ATT&CK linkage, relationship integrity validation
dependencies: Neo4j with MITRE ATT&CK nodes (691 techniques)
key_deliverables: 50-100 STIX attack patterns linked to MITRE
implementation_readiness: READY - 3-day timeline (1 day per phase: parsing, ingestion, validation), complete architecture documented

name: SBOM Dependency Analysis
intent: Implement Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) ingestion and dependency vulnerability analysis for npm and Python ecosystem packages, enabling library-level vulnerability detection and transitive dependency tracking.
business_value: HIGH - Supply chain security, CVE-to-package correlation, transitive dependency mapping, remediation path identification, compliance audit trails
technical_complexity: HIGH - SBOM format parsing (CycloneDX, SPDX), transitive dependency resolution, 316K CVE correlation, package manager API integration
implementation_readiness: READY - Complete architecture with npm/PyPI integration patterns, 316K CVE correlation strategy documented

name: Psychometric Framework Integration
intent: Integrate 53 personality framework files into AEON Digital Twin to enable Level 4 Psychology Layer threat actor profiling through validated psychological assessment frameworks (Big Five, MBTI, Dark Triad, DISC, Enneagram).
business_value: MEDIUM-HIGH - Threat actor personality profiling, insider threat prediction, attack pattern prediction, organizational risk assessment
technical_complexity: MEDIUM - 53 file ingestion, personality dimension scoring, multi-framework triangulation, temporal personality tracking
implementation_readiness: READY - Complete file organization, Neo4j schema extensions documented, validation metrics defined

name: Real-Time Threat Feed Integration
intent: Implement real-time threat feed integration connecting six authoritative threat intelligence data sources (VulnCheck, NVD, MITRE ATT&CK, CISA KEV, News sources, STIX/TAXII) to continuously populate and update the cyber security knowledge graph.
business_value: HIGH - Real-time vulnerability intelligence, automated threat feed ingestion, zero-day tracking, threat landscape visibility
technical_complexity: HIGH - API integration (6 sources), real-time ingestion pipeline, deduplication mechanisms, 5,001+ InformationEvent node enrichment
dependencies: API keys for VulnCheck, NVD, MITRE, CISA KEV
implementation_readiness: DOCUMENTED - Complete architecture and data flow pipeline documented, awaiting API key prerequisites verification

name: Wiki Truth Correction
intent: Systematically identify, document, and correct all mismatches between wiki claims and actual database records. Critical issue: Wiki claims 537,043 Equipment entities but database contains only 29,774 (94% overstatement).
business_value: CRITICAL - Restores documentation credibility, enables evidence-based decision making, ensures audit compliance, prevents leadership decisions based on false data
technical_complexity: LOW-MEDIUM - Database verification queries, wiki document updates, validation procedures
implementation_readiness: READY - Critical issue identified, verification complete, correction strategy documented

name: IEC 62443 Industrial Safety Integration
intent: Integrate IEC 62443 industrial control system security standards into AEON DT graph database, enabling security zone modeling (SL1-SL4), safety-critical system assessment, compliance validation, and investment prioritization for 29,774+ industrial equipment nodes.
business_value: VERY HIGH - Regulatory compliance (NIS2, NERC CIP, TSA), quantifiable security investment decisions ($645K investment avoids $111M losses, 173x ROI), systematic risk reduction (70% reduction)
technical_complexity: HIGH - Safety zone modeling, conduit security mapping, foundational requirements (FR1-FR7) compliance tracking, 29,774 equipment node mapping, security level gap analysis
key_deliverables: Safety zone modeling (5 security levels: Level 0-4)
Conduit security mapping for data flow protection
Component Security Levels (SL-C) vs Target Security Levels (SL-T) gap analysis
Equipment certification status and upgrade paths
implementation_readiness: READY - Complete 1,625-line documentation, 4-phase implementation roadmap (foundation, assessment, remediation, monitoring), addresses McKenney Questions Q2, Q3, Q8

name: NOW/NEXT/NEVER Prioritization Framework
intent: Implement risk-based threat triage system categorizing 316,000+ CVE vulnerabilities into actionable priority categories (NOW: immediate action, NEXT: scheduled remediation, NEVER: risk acceptance) by combining technical vulnerability metrics (CVSS, EPSS) with organizational psychological factors (cognitive biases, patch velocity, risk tolerance).
business_value: VERY HIGH - Optimizes resource allocation for 316K CVE overload, predicts sector-specific urgency, addresses cognitive bias impact on patching, enables 99.8% vulnerability deferral with data-driven justification
technical_complexity: HIGH - 316K CVE scoring algorithm, psychological factor integration, sector-specific risk tolerance modeling, EPSS evolution prediction, 5.06M PriorityAssessment nodes
key_deliverables: Sector-specific priority predictions (Energy NOW ≠ Commercial NOW)
Integration with McKenney Questions Q3, Q8, Q10
implementation_readiness: READY - Complete 913-line documentation, scoring algorithm defined, 4-phase deployment strategy (POC, multi-sector validation, full deployment, ML enhancement), validation test cases documented
